title: Police release CCTV image of man they wish to speak to after teen raped in woods
text:

Police have released a CCTV image of a man they wish to speak to after a teenager was raped in woodland.

Officers were called to Charlestown Road, Blackley, shortly before 9.30pm, following reports that an 18-year-old woman was raped on Saturday, July 20.

It is understood the attack took place in the Baileys Wood area, around the corner, at around 9.15pm. No arrests have been made.

Specially trained officers have been providing support to the victim, and detectives have released a CCTV image of a man they wish to speak to in connection with the attack.

(Image: Getty Images)

Investigators are appealing to anyone who recognises the man in the CCTV image to come forward.

Detective Constable Karen Benson, of GMP’s City of Manchester division, said: “No one should be subjected to such a terrifying attack, and we have been carrying out numerous enquiries since this incident to find the person responsible.

“We are now appealing for the public’s help in identifying the person in this photo as we want to speak to him in connection with what happened. Please get in touch if you think you might know him.”

Anybody with information about the incident should contact police on 0161 856 1146, or the independent charity Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111.
description: Police say they have been carrying out numerous inquiries and urged anyone with information to contact them
